question.title: Why does my Spring Boot server always start on port 8080?
question.body:
I have a Spring Boot application which should start on port 8090. In my application.yml I set the set these parameter :

spring:
  application:
    name: reactive-user
  server:
    port: 8090
  h2:
    console:
      enabled: true
      path: /h2-console
  main:
    allow-bean-definition-overriding: true
  r2dbc:
    url: r2dbc:h2:mem:///myusers
    username: sa
    password: password
  sql:
    init:
      platform: h2
      mode: always

But when the application start I see this log :

Tomcat started on port 8080 (http) with context path '/'

At the beginning the Spring Initializer generate an application.properties and I rename it in application.yaml. I have only one configuration file.

Is anyone can help me on this issue.
